page.title: 12Gordon Castle
page.content: {GORDON CASTLE,}the seat of the Duke of Richmond and Gordon was built by the Duke in 1775,a year before he moved the local people to the planned village outside the castle policies. In 1834 a chapel was built alongside the castle. In the 1930's because of the pressure of death duties on the family the estate was sold to the Crown who divided the land and rented it to tenants for farming. During the Second World War 1939-45 the castle was used to house Canadian troops and at the end of the war repair costs meant that part of the castle was pulled down leaving only the tower and some minor wings. At present the building is occupied by General Gordon-Lennox a member of the Gordon family who runs the land as a market garden.
